events.title: Notepad++ Hosting Breach Attributed to China-Linked Lotus Blossom Hacking Group
events.summary:
A China-linked threat actor known as Lotus Blossom has been attributed with medium confidence to the recently discovered compromise of the infrastructure hosting Notepad++.

events.title: Researchers Find 341 Malicious ClawHub Skills Stealing Data from OpenClaw Users
events.summary:
A security audit of 2,857 skills on ClawHub has found 341 malicious skills across multiple campaigns, according to new findings from Koi Security, exposing users to new supply chain risks.

events.title: OpenClaw Bug Enables One-Click Remote Code Execution via Malicious Link
events.summary:
A high-severity security flaw has been disclosed in OpenClaw (formerly referred to as Clawdbot and Moltbot) that could allow remote code execution (RCE) through a crafted malicious link.

events.title: Microsoft Begins NTLM Phase-Out With Three-Stage Plan to Move Windows to Kerberos
events.summary:
Microsoft has announced a three-phase approach to phase out New Technology LAN Manager (NTLM) as part of its efforts to shift Windows environments toward stronger, Kerberos-based options.

events.summary:

events.title: Open VSX Publisher Account Hijacked in Fresh GlassWorm Attack
events.summary:
A hacker published malicious versions of four established VS Code extensions to distribute a GlassWorm malware loader.

events.title: Default ICS Credentials Exploited in Destructive Attack on Polish Energy Facilities
events.summary:
Poland’s CERT has published a report on the recent attack, providing new details on targeted ICS and attribution.

events.summary:
Security leaders share how artificial intelligence is changing malware, ransomware, and identity-led intrusions, and how defenses must evolve.

events.title: Over 1,400 MongoDB Databases Ransacked by Threat Actor
events.summary:
Of 3,100 unprotected MongoDB instances, half remain compromised, most of them by a single threat actor.

events.title: Attackers Harvest Dropbox Logins Via Fake PDF Lures
events.summary: A malware-free phishing campaign targets corporate inboxes and asks employees to view "request orders," ultimately leading to Dropbox credential theft.

events.title: County Pays $600K to Wrongfully Jailed Pen Testers
events.summary: Iowa police arrested two penetration testers in 2019 for doing their jobs, highlighting the risk to security professionals in red teaming exercises.

events.title: Chinese Hackers Hijack Notepad++ Updates for 6 Months
events.summary: State-sponsored threat actors compromised the popular code editor's hosting provider to redirect targeted users to malicious downloads.

events.title: ShinyHunters Expands Scope of SaaS Extortion Attacks
events.summary: Following its attacks on Salesforce instances last year, members of the cybercrime group have broadened their targeting and gotten more aggressive with extortion tactics.

events.title: Torq Moves SOCs Beyond SOAR With AI-Powered Hyper Automation
events.summary: Investors poured $140 million into Torq's Series D Round, raising the startup's valuation to $1.2 billion, to bring AI-based "hyper automation" to SOCs.
